LoS (Age of Sigmar) [1,680pts]

  • **Pitched Battle** 2,000 (Death: Legions of Nagash and Nighthaunt) [1,680pts]

    Rules: Returning Slain Models - Nighthaunt

    • Leader [860pts]

      • Knight of Shrouds [100pts]

        Categories: DEATH, HERO, MALIGNANT, NIGHTHAUNT, KNIGHT OF SHROUDS, Leader

        Command Abilities: Spectral Overseer, Unit: Knight of Shrouds, Unit Abilities: Ethereal, Fly, Stolen Hours, Weapon: Sword of Stolen Hours


        Command Abilities Command Ability Details Ref
        Spectral Overseer If this model is your general and uses this command ability, then in the combat phase of this turn, add 1 to hit rolls for friendly NIGHTHAUNT models while they are wholly within 9" of it.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Knight of Shrouds 6"5104+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Ethereal Ignore modifiers (positive or negative) when making save rolls for this unit.
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Stolen Hours Each time a wound inflicted by this model’s Sword of Stolen Hours slays an enemy HERO, heal 1 wound allocated to this model.

      • Neferata, Mortarch of Blood [380pts]

        Categories: DEATH, VAMPIRE, DEATHLORDS, MONSTER, HERO, WIZARD, MORTARCH, NEFERATA, SOULBLIGHT, Leader, Behemoth

        Command Abilities: Twilight's Allure, Magic: Neferata, Neferata's Wounds Suffered: 0-2, 3-4, 5-6, 7-8, 9+, Spell: Arcane Bolt, Dark Mist, Mystic Shield, Unit: Neferata, Mortarch of Blood, Unit Abilities: Dagger of Jet, Deathly Invocation, Fly, Frightful Touch, Mortarch of Blood, Weapon: Aken-seth, Akmet-har, Spirits' Spectral Claws and Daggers


        Command Abilities Command Ability Details Ref
        Twilight's Allure If Neferata uses this ability, then until your next hero phase subtract 1 from hit rolls for enemy units that are within the range shown on the damage table.
        Magic Cast/UnbindSpells Known Ref
        Neferata 2/2Neferata is a WIZARD. She can attempt to cast two spells in your hero phase, and attempt to unbind two spells in the enemy hero phase. She knows the Arcane Bolt, Mystic Shield and Dark Mist spells.
        Neferata's Wounds Suffered MoveEbon ClawsTwilight's Allure Ref
        0-2 16"615"
        3-4 13"512"
        5-6 10"49"
        7-8 7"36"
        9+ 4"23"
        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Arcane Bolt 5If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. That unit suffers 1 mortal wound. If the casting roll was 10 or more, the unit suffers D3 mortal wounds instead.
        Dark Mist 6If successfully cast, pick a friendly DEATH unit within 18" of the caster. Until your next hero phase, that unit can fly and you must ignore modifiers (positive or negative) when making save rolls for the unit.
        Mystic Shield 6If successfully cast, pick a friendly unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. Re-roll save rolls of 1 for that unit until your next hero phase.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Neferata, Mortarch of Blood *11104+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Dagger of Jet If a model is allocated any wounds from attacks made using Akmet-har but is not slain, roll a dice after Neferata has finished making all of her attacks. On a 6+ that model is slain.
        Deathly Invocation At the start of your hero phase, pick up to 4 different friendly SUMMONABLE units within 18" of Neferata. You can heal D3 wounds that have been allocated to each unit you picked (roll separately for each unit). If no wounds are currently allocated to a unit you have picked, you may instead return a number of slain models to it that have a combined Wounds characteristic equal to or less than the roll of a D3.
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Frightful Touch If the unmodified roll for an attack made with the <Banshee Mandmaidens' Spectral Claws>, <Wraith Herald's Spectral Claws>, <Fellreaper>, <Reaper Scythe> <Chill Dagger> <Spectral Scythe> <Cairn Wraith's Reaper Scythe> <Spectral Claws and Daggers> <Spectral Host's Ethereal Weapons>, <Mourngul's Nightmarish Claws and Fangs> is 6, that attack inflicts <the weapon damage as a> mortal wound and the attack sequence ends (do not make a wound or save roll).
        Mortarch of Blood At the end of any combat phase in which Neferata slew any models, you can heal 2 wounds that have been allocated to her. If Neferata slew any enemy HERO models this turn, you may heal 1 additional wound allocated to her.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Aken-seth Melee1"22+3+-22
        Akmet-har Melee1"52+3+-11
        Spirits' Spectral Claws and Daggers Melee1"65+4+-1

    • Behemoth [300pts]

      • Terrorgheist [300pts]

        Categories: DEATH, MONSTER, TERRORGHEIST, Behemoth

        Terrorgheist Wounds Suffered: 00-03, 04-06, 07-09, 10-12, 13+, Unit: Terrorgheist, Unit Abilities: Death Shriek, Fly, Gaping Maw, Infested - ROLL D3, Weapon: Death Shriek, Fanged Maw, Skeletal Claws


        Terrorgheist Wounds Suffered MoveDeath ShriekSkeletal Claws Ref
        00-03 14"64
        04-06 12"54
        07-09 10"43
        10-12 8"33
        13+ 6"22
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Terrorgheist *14104+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Death Shriek When making a Death Shriek attack, pick an enemy unit within range and roll a dice, adding the number shown in the damage table. If the total is higher than that unit’s Bravery characteristic, it suffers a number of mortal wounds equal to the difference.
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Gaping Maw Each time you make a hit roll of 6+ for this model’s Fanged Maw, the attack is automatically successful. Determine damage normally (do not make a wound or save roll) but increase the weapon’s Damage characteristic to 6.
        Infested - ROLL D3 When this model is slain, before removing the model, each unit (friend or foe) within 3" of it suffers D3 mortal wounds.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Death Shriek Missile Weapon10"1****
        Fanged Maw Melee3"34+3+-2D6
        Skeletal Claws Melee2"*4+3+-1D3

      • Dire Wolves [70pts]

        Unit: Dire Wolves, Unit Abilities: DOOM WOLF, Slavering Charge, Vigour Necris, Weapon: Rotting Fangs and Claws


        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Dire Wolves 10"2105+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        DOOM WOLF The leader of this unit is a Doom Wolf. Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of a Doom Wolf’s Rotting Fangs and Claws.
        Slavering Charge Add 1 to wound rolls for this unit if it completed a charge move this turn.
        Vigour Necris Add 1 to save rolls for this unit if it is within 9" of any friendly CORPSE CARTS.

        Scent of Gore If an enemy model is slain within 6" of this unit, increase the Attacks characteristic of this unit’s Elongated Fangs to 6 for the rest of the battle.

    • Battalion [270pts]

      • Battalion: *DEATHMARCH [160pts]

        Categories: DEATH, Battalion

        Battalion Abilities: March of the Dead, Unbreaking Ranks


        Battalion Abilities Battalion Ability Details Ref
        March of the Dead ‘At the start of your hero phase, each unit from this battalion wholly within 12" of the battalion’s Wight King and more than 3" from any enemy units can move 4". The units cannot run, or move within 3" of an enemy unit, and the distance to the Wight King must be measured before any of the moves are made.’ *FAQ v1.3*
        Unbreaking Ranks At the start of your hero phase, you can return 1 slain model to each Deathmarch unit that is within 9" of the battalion’s WIGHT KING.

      • Battalion: Shroudguard [110pts]

        Categories: DEATH, Battalion

        Battalion Abilities: Frenzied Fervor


        Battalion Abilities Battalion Ability Details Ref
        Frenzied Fervor Roll a dice each time you allocate a wound or mortal wound to a BLADEGHEIST REVENANT model from a unit in this battalion wholly within 12" of a KNIGHT OF SHROUDS or REIKENOR THE GRIMHAILER from the same battalion. On a 5+, that wound or mortal wound is negated. If you use this ability, you cannot also use the Deathless Spirits battle trait to try to negate the same wound or mortal wound.

    • Allegiance

      • Alliegiance

        Selections: Allegiance: Legion of Sacrament

        Categories: Allegiance

        Battle Trait: Deathless Minions, Gravesite: Invigorating Aura, Magic, The Black Disciples, The Master's Teachings, The Unquiet Dead


        Battle Trait Battle Trait Details Ref
        Deathless Minions Roll a dice each time you allocate a wound or mortal wound to a friendly DEATH unit within 6" of your general or another friendly DEATH HERO. On a 6+ the wound is negated.
        Gravesite: Invigorating Aura At the start of your hero phase, pick a friendly SUMMONABLE unit within 9" of this gravesite. You can either heal D3 wounds that have been allocated to it or, if no wounds are currently allocated to the unit, you may return a number of slain models to it that have a combined Wounds characteristic equal to or less than the roll of a D3.
        Magic All WIZARDS in a LEGION OF SACRAMENT army know an additional spell from one of the Lores of the Dead.
        The Black Disciples Friendly LEGION OF SACRAMENT WIZARDS may add 1 to casting rolls.
        The Master's Teachings Whenever an enemy unit is destroyed, before removing the last model, you may pick one of your gravesites within 6" of that model. Roll a dice, then remove the model. On a 4+, you may pick a friendly SUMMONABLE unit that has been destroyed and set it up again wholly within 9" of that gravesite and more than 9" from any enemy models.
        The Unquiet Dead After territories have been determined, but before any units have been set up, you may pick up to 2 points in your territory and up to 2 points anywhere on the battlefield to be gravesites. You may wish to place suitable markers on these points. Instead of setting up a SUMMONABLE unit on the battlefield, you can place it to one side and say that it is set up in the grave. You can do this with as many units as you wish. At the end of your movement phase, for each friendly Death Hero within 9" of a gravesite, you may pick a single friendly unit in the grave and set it up wholly within 9" of the gravesite and more than 9" from any enemy models. Any model that is unable to be set up in this way is slain. If a unit is still in the grave at the end of the battle, it is considered to be slain. *ERRATA Jun'18*

      • Game Type

        Selections: 2000 Points - Battlehost

        Categories: Game Options, Battlehost

    • Malign Sorcery [100pts]

      • Endless Spell: Lauchon the Soulseeker [60pts]

        Categories: ENDLESS SPELL, LAUCHON THE SOULSEEKER, SHYISH, Malign Sorcery

        Spell: Summon Lauchon the Soulseeker, Unit Abilities: Empowered by Shyish, Fly, Navigate Deathly Tides, Predatory, Soul Price


        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Summon Lauchon the Soulseeker 6If successfully cast, set up a Lauchon the Soulseeker model wholly within 12" of the caster.
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Empowered by Shyish If your battle is taking place in the Realm of Death, this model can move up to 18" instead of up to 12".
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Navigate Deathly Tides When this model is set up, the player who set it up can immediately make a move with it.
        Predatory Lauchon the Soulseeker is a predatory endless spell. It can move up to 12" and can fly.
        Soul Price Before a player makes a move with this model, that player can pick a friendly unit wholly within 3" of this model. Remove that unit and place it to one side. After this model has moved, set that unit up again wholly within 3" of this model and more than 9" from any enemy units. Once that unit has been set up, 1 model from that unit is immediately slain.

      • Endless Spell: Shyish Reaper [20pts]

        Categories: DEATH, SHYISH REAPER, Malign Sorcery

        Spell: Summon Shyish Reaper, Unit Abilities: Empowered by Shyish, Fly, Predatory, Soul Reaper, Sweeping Death


        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Summon Shyish Reaper 7Only Nagash, Supreme Lord of the Undead and Nighthaunt Wizards can attempt to cast Summon Shyish Reaper. [...] If successfully cast, set up a Shyish Reaper model wholly within 6" of the caster.
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Empowered by Shyish If your battle is being fought in the Realm of Shyish, a Shyish Reaper can move 12" instead of 8".
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Predatory Shyish Reaper is a predatory endless spell. It can move up to 8" and can fly.
        Soul Reaper Before moving a Shyish Reaper, pivot the model on the centre of its base so that it points lengthways in the direction you wish it to move. Then move it in a straight line in that direction. The initial pivot is free and does not count towards the distance the model moves. After this model has moved, roll a dice for each model that it moved over (including models it moved over when it pivoted); if the roll is equal to or greater than the model’s Save characteristic, that model’s unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
        Sweeping Death When this model is set up, the player who set it up can immediately make a move with it.

      • Endless Spell: Shyish Reaper [20pts]

        Categories: DEATH, SHYISH REAPER, Malign Sorcery

        Spell: Summon Shyish Reaper, Unit Abilities: Empowered by Shyish, Fly, Predatory, Soul Reaper, Sweeping Death


        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Summon Shyish Reaper 7Only Nagash, Supreme Lord of the Undead and Nighthaunt Wizards can attempt to cast Summon Shyish Reaper. [...] If successfully cast, set up a Shyish Reaper model wholly within 6" of the caster.
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Empowered by Shyish If your battle is being fought in the Realm of Shyish, a Shyish Reaper can move 12" instead of 8".
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Predatory Shyish Reaper is a predatory endless spell. It can move up to 8" and can fly.
        Soul Reaper Before moving a Shyish Reaper, pivot the model on the centre of its base so that it points lengthways in the direction you wish it to move. Then move it in a straight line in that direction. The initial pivot is free and does not count towards the distance the model moves. After this model has moved, roll a dice for each model that it moved over (including models it moved over when it pivoted); if the roll is equal to or greater than the model’s Save characteristic, that model’s unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
        Sweeping Death When this model is set up, the player who set it up can immediately make a move with it.

Force Rules

Returning Slain Models - Nighthaunt: Several Nighthaunt abilities allow you to return slain models to a unit. When you do so, set up the models one at a time within 1" of a model from the unit they are returning to (this can be a model you returned to the unit earlier in the same phase).

The slain models you return to a unit can only be set up withi 3" of an enemy unit if one or more models from the unit they are returning to are already within 3" of an enemy unit. (Battletome: Nighthaunt)
